Articles.Content:
Ok, so I will just say straight forward that I know how to download mods on KSP. I have pumped my game full of mods, probably about 40 of them, and I know how to do it. I don't bother with CKAN, I think it is even harder than manual install (sorry to the devs of CKAN, that is just my opinion). One day, I decided to download the RSS/RO combination for 1.3.1. I got all the dependencies, all the files, read the READMEs on how to download and install each mod, and put them in the KSP/Gamedata/ folder. There is now folders with the following names inside:

Kopernicus

KSCSwitcher

ModularFlightIntegrator

RealSolarSystem

RSSDateTime

RSS- Textures

Squad

ModuleManager.4.0.3.dll

 

Knowing  me, it will be somehting stupid. But I have checked the version, and it is actually always the outdated mods like KSCSwitcher and RSSDateTime that work, but not the RSS itself (eg the launch site in France is in the middle of an ocean). I tried downloading RO, but that had the exact same problem. Any ideas on why it isn't working would be greatly appreciated!

32 minutes ago, jonathonF said:

I don't bother with CKAN, I think it is even harder than manual install (sorry to the devs of CKAN, that is just my opinion).

 

One day, I decided to download the RSS/RO combination for 1.3.1

 

ModuleManager.4.0.3.dll

Kind of ironic that you're posting about a problem that CKAN would have prevented and drastically simplifies the investigation of:

(You're using a ModuleManager that isn't compatible with KSP 1.3.1.)

Wow, thanks @HebaruSan! I knew it wouldn't be the RSS files themselves, but thank you for the eye-opener! It worked, and now I see how CKAN would help. I did not know it managed different versions for you! Once again, thank you tons! I can finally do that 100% reusable mission to Mars that Stratzenblitz 75 did (correction: attempt to do that 100% reusable mission). I will download CKAN, and learn it, because it now sounds like a pretty handy tool!
